intro: Pleurothallis roseola, commonly known as the rose-like orchid, is a species native to the cloud forests of Central and South America. It belongs to the Orchidaceae family and is characterized by its compact growth habit and delicate, fragrant flowers. The plant typically produces small, pink or purple blooms that are often adorned with intricate patterns. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and requires well-draining soil to prevent root rot. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and valuable species in botanical collections.
